## Cached r code, not displayed
We obtain the Root Mean Squared Error for predicting conservatism based on age and happiness by a 3-fold cross-validation approach in the Disney Universe. The results are:
```{r CahcedNoDisplay, cache=TRUE, echo=FALSE}
k <- 3
ind <- rep(c(1:k), length.out = nrow(df))

set.seed(6164900)
df$ind <- sample(ind, nrow(df))

df[, 2:4] <- sapply(df[, 2:4], as.numeric)

RMSE <- c()
for(i in 1:k){
  train <- df[df$ind != i,]
  test <- df[df$ind == i,]
  
  fit.lm <- lm(conservatism ~ age + happiness, data = train)
  pred <- predict(fit.lm, newdata = test)
  RMSE <- append(RMSE, (mean(sqrt((test$conservatism - pred)^2))))
  rm(train,test,fit.lm,pred)
}

print(list(RMSE = RMSE))

```
It seems that we do a pretty bad job since conservatism is measured on a scale from 1-10.
This is likely due to the low sample size and the fact that the data is complete nonsense.
